ratings.comment: I learned a lot in this class. Hildner gave very well-organized lectures and helpful assignments. We wrote 4-5 papers throughout the semester and 2-3 short HW per week. He is a pretty harsh grader, but it's fair for this level of class (311). I was definitely humbled by this class (RIP my ego) but Hildner is a great professor overall.

Dr. Hildner is a very good teacher who knows what he's talking about. While the class follows a pretty consistent schedule and routine of activities, sometimes the grading criteria doesn't make a lot of sense. That being said, a very cool guy, would definitely take another class with him.

Prof. Hildner knows a lot about the Spanish language. His grading criteria isn't clearly-defined, however, and the highest class score on most assignments would be around a 92%. This course was challenging, but I learned SO MUCH in it. ALSO, he has a final exam & paper for this class, but most of the other SPAN311 teachers don't.
a NICE old gentleman. A nice researcher. Not a nice teacher
Definitely knows what he teaches. But not an easy grader.  He requires you to be at a certain level, though it was a intermediate class. Not recommending.
Not an easy grader. He definitely knows a lot, but you should choose more friendly instructors if you have the chance.

Folks, let me tell you something before  you choose him: He does not give you t full participation grade even if you attend every class and speak every class. You know hat I mean? He has a formula to calculate your participation and no one gets full credit. Avoid him, not a very fuzzy guy.

Professor Hildner is one of the best professors I have ever had. His knowledge of Spanish grammar is incredible and he teaches the class very well. Although the class does require that you put in a fair amount of effort, at the end of the semester you will leave with a very deep understanding of the Spanish language.

The class is not too difficult but Hildner is kind of strange. He ignores the students who frequently participate, obviously wanting others to participate but when they don't he just answers himself. Participation is mandatory, but how do you do this when he ignores you? Bizarro.

David... He was a nice guy but I would say that he was not an easy grader. Also he  did not have a clear criteria. He won't let you fail the class bu t don't expect to get a A even you put a lot of efforts. It is not impossible to get an A but you should consider this beforehand.

Professor Hildner is one of the best Spanish professors I have had. He is passionate about teaching and wants to see everyone succeed. He lets you correct your papers until you get the grade you want. He is very knowledgable and tests can be difficult, but anyone can get at least a B in the class if they put in enough work. I would recommend him.

Professor Hildner is fantastic! He was one of my favorite professors during my undergrad. He's definitely a bit nerdy. His material is classic and the analysis is spot on. If you feel like you're beginning to get comfortable in discussions but it's more of a "classroom Spanish" than fluent, this class addresses precisely that aspect of your study.
Extremely knowledgeable about the material presented. Lectures are a bit boring but he explains all the readings in depth, which is nice for the exams and papers.
Renaissance and Baroque Spanish Poetry: SO. INCREDIBLY. BORING. Hildner makes cheesy and/or disturbing sexual jokes and drones on and on. Fair grader and pretty lenient about deadlines, though.

This was a grammar class, so some may think it a little boring, but Dr. Hildner knows Spanish grammar very well and makes the students analise the language at a level most are not used to in a 300 class. Clear explanations, but not much variety in presentations or class activities.

Interesting guy, with some pretty entertaining personality quirks. Knows his stuff for sure. Grades very fairly- cares more about content then grammar, but will mark every singly error on your paper anyway. I managed an A even though I suck at Spanish, but regardless the class is interesting and worth taking.
Yes, he definitely knows grammar, which lead me to call him the grammar Nazi.  I felt he was a little too hard on native speakers though.

Very knowledgeable professor.  He knows the language inside and out.  Took summer class, so homework load was a bit intense.  Tests were easy, but I love Spanish.  Make sure to proof read your essays diligently because they're graded on grammar mistakes.  Very good about keeping class moving, not boring at all.  Looking forward to taking him again.

This class is really tough. Only take it if you absolutely need it. He's a pretty cool, easy going prof. but he is a tough grader. He really wants his students to know the material well. Other than that he'll help you if you ask for it. (he's a good guys to ask for grad school letter of recommendations).
Very difficult class and teacher, but he knows grammar inside and out.
